faq.question: ¿Puedo usar la misma imagen en diferentes modelos de iPhone?
faq.answer: Sí, pero usa la resolución más alta entre tus dispositivos. El sistema escalará automáticamente, pero la calidad será mejor si la imagen coincide con la resolución del dispositivo.

faq.question: ¿Importa si uso JPEG o PNG?
faq.answer: JPEG es generalmente mejor para fotos (menor tamaño), PNG para gráficos con texto o colores sólidos. HEIC ofrece la mejor calidad/tamaño para dispositivos iOS.

faq.question: Why does my wallpaper look blurry?
faq.answer: Your image is too low . iPhone displays are very sharp (460 PPI on Pro models). Upscale your image to match the dimensions above.

quickReference.note: If unsure, use 1290x2796px - it works well on most modern iPhones when cropped.

tips.title: Account for the notch/Dynamic Island
tips.description: Don't put important content at the very top of your wallpaper. The top 50-100 pixels may be covered by the notch or Dynamic Island.

tips.title: Lock screen vs home screen
tips.description: iOS uses the same image size for both, but clock and widgets may cover parts. Keep focal points centered.

tips.title: Parallax effect adds cropping
tips.description: iOS perspective zoom crops about 10% on each edge. Either disable it in Settings, or add extra margin to your image.

upscalingGuide.scenario: Want to use a 640x960 image as iPhone 15 wallpaper
steps: Crop to 19.5:9 aspect ratio (1290x2796 or use the upscaled size)
If quality is good, crop directly; if not, upscale again

pages.title: Android Wallpaper sizes
pages.metaDescription: Wallpaper dimensions for popular Android phones. Samsung Galaxy, Google Pixel, OnePlus and more with exact pixel dimensions.
pages.intro: Android wallpaper sizes vary by manufacturer and model. Here are dimensions for the most popular devices.

quickReference.note: This size works for most flagship Android phones. Android scales well.

tips.title: Android scrolling wallpapers
tips.description: Some Android launchers support scrolling wallpapers that are wider than the screen. Create at 2x width for this effect.

tips.title: Hole-punch cameras
tips.description: Most modern Android phones have a punch-hole camera. Avoid putting important content in the top-left or top-center.

tips.title: Android scales well
tips.description: Android handles mismatched wallpaper sizes better than iOS. A slightly larger image will be cropped automatically.

faq.question: What size wallpaper for Samsung Galaxy S24?
faq.answer: 1080x2340 for Galaxy S24, 1440x3120 for S24+ and S24 Ultra.

faq.question: Does Android need exact dimensions?
faq.answer: No. Android handles cropping well. Use a larger image and Android will let you position it. 1440x3200 works for most phones.

faq.question: What about Android tablets?
faq.answer: Tablets vary widely. Check your tablet's display in Settings > About Phone > Display. Common sizes are 2560x1600 and 2800x1752.

pages.title: Desk & Monitor Wallpaper sizes
pages.metaDescription: Monitor wallpaper dimensions for all s. 1080p, 1440p, 4K, 5K, ultRAWide and multi-monitor setups.
pages.intro: Find the right wallpaper size for your monitor. Covers standard, ultRAWide, and multi-monitor setups.

quickReference.note: 4K (3840x2160) is becoming standard for new monitors.

dimensions.notes: Most common, works on most monitors

tips.title: Check your actual resolution
tips.description: Right-click desktop > Display settings (Windows) or System Preferences > Displays (Mac) to see exact dimensions.

tips.title: Multi-monitor spanning
tips.description: For wallpapers that span monitors, add the widths together. Two 1920x1080 monitors = 3840x1080 total.

tips.title: Scaling matters
tips.description: A 4K monitor at 150% scaling still uses 3840x2160 for wallpapers. Use full resolution regardless of scaling.

faq.question: What is my monitor?
faq.answer: Windows: Right-click desk > Display settings > . Mac: Apple menu > System Preferences > Displays.

faq.question: Should wallpaper match monitor exactly?
faq.answer: Ideally yes. Larger is OK (will be cropped/scaled). Smaller will look blurry when stretched.

faq.question: What about retina/HiDPI displays?
faq.answer: Use the actual , not the 'looks like' . A 27" iMac at 'looks like 2560x1440' actually uses 5120x2880 for wallpapers.
